_comment: Created by ianb on 27/04/2015 18:13:24 using v2.5
title: Which organisations are responsible for the number of patients delayed?
analysis_commentary: Again the overall pattern seen in the number of patients experiencing a delayed transfer of care is not uniformly replicated when looking at which organisations are responsible for the delay. There is a downward trend in the number of patients delayed over time when the delay is due to social care organisations but an upward trend when the delay is due to NHS organisations or when both organisations are responsible. For NHS there is a 13% increase in the number of patients experiencing a delay in discharge, a 28% increase when both types of organisations are responsible and a 26% decrease when the responsibility is down to social care organisations.
data_source: NHS England, Delayed transfer of care
